solution_line_template: An evening movie is ${evening_ticket_cost} and the food combo would be ${food_combo_cost} so {evening_ticket_cost} + {food_combo_cost} = $<<{evening_ticket_cost}+{food_combo_cost}={total_evening_cost}>>{total_evening_cost}

If he goes to an earlier movie, it's {ticket_discount_percent_text}% off the normal ticket price of ${evening_ticket_cost} so {evening_ticket_cost} * {ticket_discount_percent_decimal} = $<<{evening_ticket_cost}*{ticket_discount_percent_decimal}={ticket_discount_amount}>>{ticket_discount_amount}

If he goes to an earlier movie, it's {food_discount_percent_text}% off the normal food price of ${food_combo_cost} so {food_combo_cost} * {food_discount_percent_decimal} = $<<{food_combo_cost}*{food_discount_percent_decimal}={food_discount_amount}>>{food_discount_amount}

If he saves ${ticket_discount_amount} for the ticket and ${food_discount_amount} on food, then {ticket_discount_amount}+{food_discount_amount} = $<<{ticket_discount_amount}+{food_discount_amount}={total_savings}>>{total_savings} saved
